Story #5 Part-1

  • March 11, 2021
  • Zizi

I remember spring of 2003. It was the time when half of my classmates, including me, passed the entering exams for University in Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk. Everything was simple and clear. I am going into the University with almost all my friends. That was so great. We celebrated and started getting ready for the graduation high school exams. I was bad at spelling in Russian language but very good at literature, so we made a deal with the teacher of those two subjects that if I write my last exam for a good mark she will put it for Russian language in my school diploma. But it turned surprisingly different. The teacher put a good mark for Russian language and literature as well. My class teacher tried to talk to her, because it did not make any sense as I had an excellent mark for literature every year. You might think that I was reading a lot, but that was not like it. Every year I was buying a book with summaries of all books we were going through. So just before the class I read the summary and when I spoke I made an image of deep understanding of the book. As you already know I’ve got that characteristic of giving a wonderful speech. So the teacher disagreed to go according to the deal and left good marks for both subjects. It was so weird for me. Why would you do this to a kid at the graduation? Does this really mean so much to throw this stone at the end. In spite of this I still had a good mood because we were preparing the last party for all the teachers and parents. We worked a lot on our last dance and decided to sing a song for our class teacher. There was no-one willing to sing. So the choice fell on me and another girl. We were not good at it but agreed and did our best to sound fine. That was the firs and the last of my singing on the stage. On last night we reached the bottom of the teacher’s heart with that song. Two days before our party my mother said that I am going to Smolensk, a city on the opposite end of Russia, on the morning flight right after the party. My world cracked. All I knew was going to pass away, and I had to go to another city and I have two months to enter the university. I did not know what will happen if I won’t. And I could not really think about it. I was going to another city to live alone. I was 16. The news were so shocking that I felt paralyzed and had nothing to say. I could not enjoy the party knowing that I’m going to fly away tomorrow. Why would you buy tickets right after the party? No time was given to say goodbye to my life and friends.

This action of my mom led me to hysteria with every move in my long travelling which started in 2018. Every single move generated so much tension and fear that I could hardly gather my stuff. I became very upset and angry at the same time. I recognized this connection only in 2021. The feeling of being kicked out of the house made me feel no more needed and a burden. My elder brother died from alcoholism partially because of the same feeling. The First factor was the feeling of being not loved by my father and then being kicked out from his home when he was around 16. So as we see my mother threw the first two children out of her house with a new family. This fact also gave me a strong feeling of being betrayed and traded for a man. That man did not really help with earning money or taking care of the house. He abused all of us and behaved as a pig. He was drinking every evening but fortunately after a bottle of vodka he always went to sleep. In these relations of my mother I can see her most powerful fear of being alone without a man. And as we say to have no-one to bring you a glass of water in the moment of death coming. So she stayed with that man no matter how bad everything went. I did not realize why my elder brother felt so bad for a long time. The story of our past was gathering slowly like a puzzle. I collected all the peaces recently. He died in 2018. And when I realized it all in 2019 he came into my dream and I told him that I was in the same situation and I understand him now. It gave a relief.

Now let’s get back to Smolensk in 2003.

We came to Smolensk with my mother. Her mother and sister were living there, so I was supposed to be there under their attention. My mother rented me a room with shared bathroom and toilet. Kitchen was also shared for a corridor with 8 rooms. I got a kettle, table, wardrobe and working table with a chair. She said: “No TV set. You are here to study”. I begged her to buy me a cassette player because it was the most important thing in my life. I had one before and it helped to survive. Music was the thing I loved. It supported me in hard times and made me feel not alone having that. My birthday is in September, so I played my last hope saying this would be a present for my birthday. She agreed and bought me a small boombox and some Cd’s. I had never seen a CD before.

My mother spent time with her sister and mother while I was trying to understand what should I chose, so I definitely pass the entering exams in the university. My mother’s dream was that I become a translator because I was good at languages. I studied English and German at school and was good at it because I had excellent teachers. I was also good at math. Math teacher was the only one who liked me and helped. So I was thinking to become a math teacher. My fear not to enter the university and get into unknown future was so strong, so I decided to try to go through English exam. But there was a Russian dictation exam too. That was definitely super hard for me. I passed exams for two universities and because of poor spelling got in only on paid basis. I chose the non-governmental nice university. So at the end of July the decision was made. I’m going to study in Smolensk Humanitarian University.

I still was in shock that my mother threw me out of the house. It was painful. I felt that she was doing everything to her new husband: gave my home, cooked the way he liked, took a great care of their child. I was an outsider in the family and then thrown out as not needed thing. Of course, you might say: “She paid for a room, education and provided money for food and clothes during the studying period”. But I mean the emotional layer. Money can not give you human warmth or feeling of being loved.

I made my mind that I don’t need her anymore, and did not write or answer any letters. I decided to try to be better, then I was before and study really hard. During the day I worked hard in classes and wrote poems at night. Poems were as sad as the music I was listening to. I was smoking a lot and slept not much. But my dream of been a good student and learn English perfectly was not going to come true. The teacher of English grammar made her mind to get money from me, so does not matter how hard I worked I got a bad mark. I worked so hard that at one point I knew the whole book by heart. My classmates could tell me the page and I started to tell the exact text they see in the book. If in my work were the same sentences from the book the teacher would consider them wrong. My mother did not believe me and she asked her sister to go to the teacher and figure out what’s going on. My ant was a fine lady, and she understood that the teacher wants money and will not give up on this. Mother was ready to pay, but I said “No. I am not going to pay.” I worked even harder for 2 years, getting bad marks on that subject all the time. My student group were the witness of this. I believed I could go through it. The last exam for that discipline came, and I answered all my questions, three questions for excellent students, five questions for bad students perfectly. The whole group was totally impressed. They knew this is an excellent passing. The teacher said it will take her two weeks to make a decision. She was taking this exam with another teacher. I passed all other exams and then time to find out the mark came. They gave me a satisfactory mark. I was shocked. They said: “You know, we are allowed to give a certain amount for excellent and good marks, and we made our mind who will get those. So you are getting satisfactory”. That was like an earthquake for me. This is how the system works. If you don’t have money, and you are unknown in the city your hard work makes no difference. It does not matter what you do, you will get what is left. I cried in the toilet for some time and made a decision to stop studying hard. I made a deal with excellent students and copied all the works. So I started to get good marks with this copying. I had one rule: no matter what I attend all the classes and work active if the class implies this. And I definitely lost my interest and desire to stay at this faculty.

At the same time my friend Veronica noticed that I was perfect at understanding people and always knew what to ask and say. She said I should go to psychological faculty. And this felt so right.
